rules.natural: If vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine, then pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.
Provided that the government funds vaccine research, either the COVID-19 vaccine is available to the public or the antiviral drug is not available to the public.
Whenever the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine, if pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, then hospitals deploy the antiviral drug.
In the event that emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine, if pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, then hospitals deploy the antiviral drug.
Should the health ministry coordinate the logistics network, then either the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine or emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.
Either the health ministry coordinates the logistics network or the health ministry coordinates the emergency teams.
Given that the health ministry coordinates the emergency teams, then either the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine or emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.
If the vaccine system monitors side effects, then pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.
Provided that the health app monitors side effects, pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.
Whenever drug research develops the antiviral drug, pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.
If the health database tracks the vaccination rate, then either the vaccine system monitors side effects or the health app monitors side effects.

Either outbreak response contains the outbreak or, if it is not the case that not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate, then the health system does not alert about an outbreak.
Should the vaccine journal publish research results, then vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine.
Either the vaccine journal publishes research results or the drug journal publishes research results.
If the regulatory agency validates research results, then the scientific community peer reviews research results.
Either hospitals implement the vaccine protocol or clinics implement the vaccine protocol.
Whenever clinics implement the vaccine protocol, the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine.
If the vaccine lab tests the COVID-19 vaccine, then vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine.
Either the vaccine lab tests the COVID-19 vaccine or the drug lab tests the antiviral drug.
Should the backup team develop an alternative vaccine, then the regulatory agency approves the alternative vaccine.
Either the supply chain delays the alternative vaccine or the regulatory agency does not approve the alternative vaccine.
Given that the supply team resolves the supply chain, then the supply chain does not delay the alternative vaccine.
Either the supply team resolves the supply chain or emergency procurement resolves the supply chain.
In the event that emergency procurement resolves the supply chain, the supply chain does not delay the alternative vaccine.
Either the cold chain manages distribution or the transport team manages distribution.
Provided that the transport team manages distribution, emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.
Should the refrigeration system maintain the cold chain, then if the cold chain manages distribution, the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine.
Either the refrigeration system maintains the cold chain or backup generators maintain the cold chain.
If backup generators maintain the cold chain, then temperature sensors monitor the cold chain.
Given that the drug lab tests the antiviral drug, drug research develops the antiviral drug.
In the event that temperature sensors monitor the cold chain, if the cold chain manages distribution, then the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine.
Should data scientists analyze health data, then if the health database does not track the vaccination rate, it tracks the infection rate.
Either data scientists analyze health data or the AI system analyzes health data.
If the epidemic model predicts outbreak patterns, then the early system warns about outbreak risk.
Either the epidemic model predicts outbreak patterns or, if the AI system analyzes health data, then not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate.
Whenever the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine, if pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, then the regulatory agency approves the antiviral drug.
If a manufacturing issue delays the COVID-19 vaccine, then a clinical trial delays the COVID-19 vaccine.
Either a manufacturing issue delays the COVID-19 vaccine or the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine.
Should the manufacturing team resolve the manufacturing issue, then a clinical trial does not delay the COVID-19 vaccine.
If it is not the case that either the COVID-19 vaccine is available to the public or the antiviral drug is not available to the public, then the backup team develops an alternative vaccine.
In the event that it is not the case that publishing research results in the drug journal implies drug research develops the antiviral drug, the regulatory agency validates research results.
Provided that it is not the case that hospitals implementing the vaccine protocol implies the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine, then medical staff are trained in the vaccine protocol.
If it is not the case that hospitals implementing the vaccine protocol implies the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine, then medical staff are not trained in the vaccine protocol.
Should it not be the case that not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate, then the health system alerts about an outbreak.
Provided that the health database does not track the vaccination rate, it does not track the infection rate.
In the event that pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, the antiviral drug is available to the public.

It is not the case that the COVID-19 vaccine is available to the public.
It is not the case that hospitals deploy the antiviral drug.
It is not the case that outbreak response contains the outbreak.
It is not the case that the scientific community peer reviews research results.
It is not the case that the early system warns about outbreak risk.
It is not the case that the regulatory agency approves the antiviral drug.

(A1 → G).natural: If vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine, then pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine or drug research develops the antiviral drug.

(A11 ∨ ¬A10).natural: The COVID-19 vaccine is available to the public or the antiviral drug is not available to the public.

(A12 → (A11 ∨ ¬A10)).natural: Provided that the government funds vaccine research, either the COVID-19 vaccine is available to the public or the antiviral drug is not available to the public.

(A14 → (¬G → A13)).natural: Whenever the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine, if pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, then hospitals deploy the antiviral drug.

(A14 ∨ A15).natural: Either the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine or emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A15 → (¬G → A13)).natural: In the event that emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine, if pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, then hospitals deploy the antiviral drug.

(A16 → (A14 ∨ A15)).natural: Should the health ministry coordinate the logistics network, then either the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine or emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either the health ministry coordinates the logistics network or the health ministry coordinates the emergency teams.

(A17 → (A14 ∨ A15)).natural: Given that the health ministry coordinates the emergency teams, then either the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine or emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A18 → G).natural: If the vaccine system monitors side effects, then pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.

(A18 ∨ A19).natural: Either the vaccine system monitors side effects or the health app monitors side effects.

(A19 → G).natural: Provided that the health app monitors side effects, pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.

(A2 → G).natural: Whenever drug research develops the antiviral drug, pandemic response controls the COVID-19 pandemic.

(A20 → (A18 ∨ A19)).natural: If the health database tracks the vaccination rate, then either the vaccine system monitors side effects or the health app monitors side effects.

(A23 ∨ (¬(¬A20 → A21) → ¬A22)).natural: Either outbreak response contains the outbreak or, if it is not the case that not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate, then the health system does not alert about an outbreak.

(A24 → A1).natural: Should the vaccine journal publish research results, then vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A24 ∨ A25).natural: Either the vaccine journal publishes research results or the drug journal publishes research results.

(A25 → A2).natural: In the event that the drug journal publishes research results, drug research develops the antiviral drug.

(A27 → A26).natural: If the regulatory agency validates research results, then the scientific community peer reviews research results.

(A28 → A6).natural: Provided that hospitals implement the vaccine protocol, the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A28 ∨ A29).natural: Either hospitals implement the vaccine protocol or clinics implement the vaccine protocol.

(A29 → A6).natural: Whenever clinics implement the vaccine protocol, the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A3 → A1).natural: If the vaccine lab tests the COVID-19 vaccine, then vaccine research develops the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either the vaccine lab tests the COVID-19 vaccine or the drug lab tests the antiviral drug.

(A31 → A32).natural: Should the backup team develop an alternative vaccine, then the regulatory agency approves the alternative vaccine.

(A33 ∨ ¬A32).natural: Either the supply chain delays the alternative vaccine or the regulatory agency does not approve the alternative vaccine.

(A34 → ¬A33).natural: Given that the supply team resolves the supply chain, then the supply chain does not delay the alternative vaccine.

(A34 ∨ A35).natural: Either the supply team resolves the supply chain or emergency procurement resolves the supply chain.

(A35 → ¬A33).natural: In the event that emergency procurement resolves the supply chain, the supply chain does not delay the alternative vaccine.

(A36 → A14).natural: If the cold chain manages distribution, then the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A36 ∨ A37).natural: Either the cold chain manages distribution or the transport team manages distribution.

(A37 → A15).natural: Provided that the transport team manages distribution, emergency teams distribute the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A38 → (A36 → A14)).natural: Should the refrigeration system maintain the cold chain, then if the cold chain manages distribution, the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A38 ∨ A39).natural: Either the refrigeration system maintains the cold chain or backup generators maintain the cold chain.

(A39 → (A36 → A14)).natural: Whenever backup generators maintain the cold chain, if the cold chain manages distribution, then the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A39 → A40).natural: If backup generators maintain the cold chain, then temperature sensors monitor the cold chain.

(A4 → A2).natural: Given that the drug lab tests the antiviral drug, drug research develops the antiviral drug.

(A40 → (A36 → A14)).natural: In the event that temperature sensors monitor the cold chain, if the cold chain manages distribution, then the logistics network distributes the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A41 → (¬A20 → A21)).natural: Should data scientists analyze health data, then if the health database does not track the vaccination rate, it tracks the infection rate.

(A41 ∨ A42).natural: Either data scientists analyze health data or the AI system analyzes health data.

(A42 → (¬A20 → A21)).natural: Provided that the AI system analyzes health data, if the health database does not track the vaccination rate, then it tracks the infection rate.

(A43 → A44).natural: If the epidemic model predicts outbreak patterns, then the early system warns about outbreak risk.

(A43 ∨ (A42 → (¬A20 → A21))).natural: Either the epidemic model predicts outbreak patterns or, if the AI system analyzes health data, then not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate.

(A6 → (¬G → A5)).natural: Whenever the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine, if pandemic response does not control the COVID-19 pandemic, then the regulatory agency approves the antiviral drug.

(A7 → A8).natural: If a manufacturing issue delays the COVID-19 vaccine, then a clinical trial delays the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A7 ∨ A6).natural: Either a manufacturing issue delays the COVID-19 vaccine or the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine.

(A9 → ¬A8).natural: Should the manufacturing team resolve the manufacturing issue, then a clinical trial does not delay the COVID-19 vaccine.

(¬(A11 ∨ ¬A10) → A31).natural: If it is not the case that either the COVID-19 vaccine is available to the public or the antiviral drug is not available to the public, then the backup team develops an alternative vaccine.

(¬(A25 → A2) → A26).natural: If it is not the case that publishing research results in the drug journal implies drug research develops the antiviral drug, then the scientific community peer reviews research results.

(¬(A25 → A2) → A27).natural: In the event that it is not the case that publishing research results in the drug journal implies drug research develops the antiviral drug, the regulatory agency validates research results.

(¬(A28 → A6) → A30).natural: Provided that it is not the case that hospitals implementing the vaccine protocol implies the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine, then medical staff are trained in the vaccine protocol.

(¬(A28 → A6) → ¬A30).natural: If it is not the case that hospitals implementing the vaccine protocol implies the regulatory agency approves the COVID-19 vaccine, then medical staff are not trained in the vaccine protocol.

(¬(¬A20 → A21) → A22).natural: Should it not be the case that not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate, then the health system alerts about an outbreak.

(¬(¬A20 → A21) → ¬A22).natural: Whenever it is not the case that not tracking the vaccination rate implies tracking the infection rate, the health system does not alert about an outbreak.

(¬A20 → A21).natural: If the health database does not track the vaccination rate, then it tracks the infection rate.

(¬A20 → ¬A21).natural: Provided that the health database does not track the vaccination rate, it does not track the infection rate.
